name: Aspect of the Beast
url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Feats/Aspect of the Beast

sections.name: Prerequisites
sections.description: wild shape class feature, see Special.

sections.body: Your bestial nature manifests itself in one of the following ways. You choose the manifestation when you choose the feat, and then you cannot change it.
sections.name: Benefits

sections.body: If your base race has normal vision, you gain low-light vision. If your base race has low-light vision, you gain darkvision out to a range of 30 feet. If your base race has darkvision, the range of your darkvision increases by 30 feet.
sections.name: Night Senses
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Feats/Aspect of the Beast/Benefits/Night Senses

sections.body: You grow a pair of claws. These claws are primary attacks that deal 1d4 points of damage (1d3 if you are Small).
sections.name: Claws of the Beast
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Feats/Aspect of the Beast/Benefits/Claws of the Beast

sections.body: You can make a running jump without needing to run 10 feet before you jump.
sections.name: Predator's Leap
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Feats/Aspect of the Beast/Benefits/Predators Leap

sections.body: You gain a +2 bonus on initiative checks and a +2 bonus on Survival skill checks.
sections.name: Wild Instinct
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Feats/Aspect of the Beast/Benefits/Wild Instinct

sections.body: A character that has contracted lycanthropy can take this feat without having to meet the prerequisites. A ranger who selects the natural weapon combat style can take this feat without having to meet the prerequisites (even if he does not select Aspect of the Beast as a bonus feat).
sections.name: Special

description: Whether by magic or a curse of your blood, some part of you is more beast than man.
